enb_long_title: Sixth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change
sentences: A number of observers noted a change in atmosphere on Tuesday, as many negotiators seemed to respond to President Pronk's strong message on the need for urgency.

They suggested that efforts by some Parties to prevent delegates from moving forward into 'informal informal' consultations could be considered unrealistic and counterproductive. Some participants have also been discussing the escalating problem one observer referred to as the 'ping-pong' effect: the tendency to stall on taking decisions on issues that have linkages to other contact groups.

The most obvious example has been the question of sinks within the CDM, with the contact groups on the mechanisms and LULUCF trying to coordinate their respective work, an effort some suggest has been exploited by particular groups to slow talks and 'shift responsibility.
